result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis A Rolland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Rolland to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $883 plus the $50 drug testing fee= $933, less the posted $500 cash bail= $433 plus court-appointed attorney fees.  The Court grants the Defendant six months to pay this amount in full. Non-payment shall result in a 5 day jail term, with Huber privileges.
**11/5/20: Per Court's order at sentencing for Defendant to reimburse attorney fees and Attorney Huebner's Final Statement of Hours. Defendant to pay $127.50 in attorney fees.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis A Rolland

records.addlTxt: Amended
w/ elements and criminal case settlement
Final Statement of service hours in the amount of 1.5 hours submitted by Attorney Huebner.

[MK] case called at 9:42am. 
Defendant Curtis A Rolland in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
[Service of Complaint was admitted at a previous hearing]. The charges are recited. The Count #1 maximum penalties are recited. Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest " is entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated. The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3. 

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Rolland to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $883 plus the $50 drug testing fee= $933, less the posted $500 cash bail= $433 plus court-appointed attorney fees.  The Court grants the Defendant six months to pay this amount in full. Non-payment shall result in a 5 day jail term, with Huber privileges.
recess 9:56am.
[Post-Hearing:  Mr. Rolland verified that the 141 N. Hyer Lane #8 address is current.]
Initial appearance on August 21, 2020 at 09:30 am.

Karl Huebner

The Court orders repayment at the rate of $20/month until the total sum is paid; beginning 9/1/2020 & payments shall be made to the Clerk of Courts by the 1st of every month thereafter.
